original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ston par rig par bya ste /

translated: The knowledge of path aspects is the light.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni sgron ma'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni sgron ma'o //
translated: The knowledge of path aspects is the lamp.

original: blo'o // shes pa'o //
analyzed: blo'o // shes pa'o //
translated: It is the mind, it is the cognition,

original: shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab bo //
translated: it is the wisdom.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni dpung gnyen no //🔽lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni skyabs so //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni dpung gnyen no // lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni skyabs so //
translated: The knowledge of path aspects is the friend.🔽The knowledge of path aspects is the refuge.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni mgon no //🔽lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni ma'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni mgon no // lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni ma'o //
translated: The knowledge of path aspects is the protector.🔽The knowledge of path aspects is the mother.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni pha'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni pha'o //
translated: The knowledge of path aspects is the father.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar byed pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of all modes eliminates all residual impression connections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi'ang yab dang yum du gyur to //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi'ang yab dang yum du gyur to // rab 'byor / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
translated: Subhuti: Because in these thirty-seven dharmas which act as wings to enlightenment the past Tathagatas, Arhats, fully enlightened Buddhas have gone forth to the supreme enlightenment,🔽and the future Tathagatas, Arhats, fully enlightened Buddhas will go forth to the supreme enlightenment,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi'ang yab dang yum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi'ang yab dang yum du 'gyur ro //
translated: and the Tathagatas, Arhats, fully enlightened Buddhas of the present go forth to the supreme enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
translated: Subhuti : These thirty-seven dharmas which act as wings to enlightenment are the parents of the past, future, and present Buddhas and Lords.

original: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag @267b gi'ang yab dang yum du gyur to //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag @267b gi'ang yab dang yum du gyur to // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhuti : How is it that these thirty-seven dharmas which act as wings to enlightenment are the parents of the past, future, and present Buddhas and Lords?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'di las byung ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar 'di las byung ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
translated: The Lord : Because from them have come forth the past, future, and present Buddhas and Lords.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: Subhuti : Therefore then, O Lord, the Bodhisattva, the great being who wants to know full enlightenment, who wants to purify the Buddha-field and to mature all beings, should train in just these thirty-seven dharmas which act as wings to enlightenment.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya bar 'dod pas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya bar 'dod pas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can rnams bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “Those who wish to ripen beings should gather beings with the four means of gathering.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyad pa dang / don mthun pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / ngas don gyi dbang de mthong bas 'di skad du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshig snyan pa dang / don spyad pa dang / don mthun pa ste / rab 'byor / ngas don gyi dbang de mthong bas 'di skad du 'di lta ste /
translated: Generosity, kind words, purposeful activity, and harmony.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po 'di dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, seeing this benefit, I say that these thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ston pa dang / ma dang / pha dang / dpung gnyen dang / skyabs dang / mgon yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ston pa dang / ma dang / pha dang / dpung gnyen dang / skyabs dang / mgon yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: are the teachers, the mothers, the fathers, the protectors, the refuges, and the defenders of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par bya bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi the tshom bcad par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par bya bar 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa la gnas par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi the tshom bcad par 'dod pa dang /
translated: “Therefore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who wish not to be led by others, who wish to stand in not being led by others, who wish to cut through the doubts of all beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bar 'dod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya bar 'dod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya bar 'dod pas /
translated: Those who wish to purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽byang chub @268a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub @268a *//
translated: And why?

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos gang la bslab par bya ba de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos gang la bslab par bya ba de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las rgya cher bstan to //
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom itself are revealed in detail those dharmas in which the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: what is the defining characteristic of the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, the defining characteristic of the perfection of wisdom is nonattachment, like space.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is without defining characteristics.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mtshan nyid gang yang med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mtshan nyid gang yang med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has no defining mark.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One,

original: mtshan nyid gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchis pa'i mtshan nyid des chos thams cad mchis par 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs de lta bu mchis sam; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchis pa'i mtshan nyid des chos thams cad mchis par 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs de lta bu mchis sam; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: is there a way in which all dharmas are included by the defining mark by which the perfection of wisdom is included?”

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, it is so!🔽It is just as you have said!

original: mtshan nyid gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid kyis chos thams cad yod do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid kyis chos thams cad yod do //
translated: All dharmas are included by the defining mark by which the perfection of wisdom is included.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa ste /🔽chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis dben pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa ste / chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis dben pa'o //
translated: And why?🔽Subhūti, all dharmas are empty of all dharmas.🔽All dharmas are isolated from all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are empty of all dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / dben pa'i mtshan nyid du mtshan nyid gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa'i mtshan @268b nyid des chos thams cad yod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / dben pa'i mtshan nyid du mtshan nyid gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yod pa'i mtshan @268b nyid des chos thams cad yod do //
translated: Subhuti, for this reason, in the sense that the perfection of wisdom exists with the characteristic of emptiness and the characteristic of isolation, in that sense all dharmas exist.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavan,

original: gal te chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis dben la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis dben la /
translated: if all dharmas are isolated from all dharmas,

original: chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis stong na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis stong na /
translated: and all dharmas are empty of all dharmas,

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'ang ji ltar mchis par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'ang ji ltar mchis par 'gyur /
translated: how can there be the defilement and purification of beings?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavan,

original: dben pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /🔽rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dben pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur / rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: isolation does not become defiled or purified,

original: stong pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /🔽rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /🔽rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: emptiness does not become defiled or purified,🔽and the perfected nature does not become defiled or purified.

original: dben pa dang stong pa nyid ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya /
analyzed: dben pa dang stong pa nyid ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya /
translated: emptiness is not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dben pas ni stong pa nyid la chos gang yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: dben pas ni stong pa nyid la chos gang yang mi dmigs /
translated: Emptiness does not apprehend any dharma in emptiness.

original: dben pas ni stong pa nyid las sems can gang byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de lta bu mi dmigs na /
analyzed: dben pas ni stong pa nyid las sems can gang byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de lta bu mi dmigs na /
translated: Emptiness does not apprehend any being who is fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bstan pa de'i don bdag gis ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
analyzed: bstan pa de'i don bdag gis ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: how should I understand the meaning of that teaching?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sems can rnams yun ring po nas bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la spyod dam /
analyzed: sems can rnams yun ring po nas bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la spyod dam /
translated: Have beings for a long time been engaged in ‘me’ and ‘mine’?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de de ltar lags so //
analyzed: de de ltar lags so //
translated: that is so.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One,

original: de de ltar lags te /
analyzed: de de ltar lags te /
translated: that is so.

original: sems can rnams yun ring po nas bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba la spyod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams yun ring po nas bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba la spyod do //
translated: Beings have for a long time been engaged in ‘me’ and ‘mine.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: 'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir bya ba dben zhing stong ngam /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir bya ba dben zhing stong ngam /
translated: Are the self and what belongs to the self empty and void?

original: gsol pa / @269a *//
analyzed: gsol pa / @269a *//
translated: He replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽dben no // bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / dben no // bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽they are void,🔽Sugata, they are empty.”

original: stong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: stong ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /🔽'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir bya bas sems can rnams kun tu rgyug cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems / 'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir bya bas sems can rnams kun tu rgyug cing /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: kun tu 'khor bar gyur tam /
analyzed: kun tu 'khor bar gyur tam /
translated: Do sentient beings run around and circle in saṃsāra because of the self and what belongs to the self?🔽”🔽He replied:

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de de lta lags so //
analyzed: de de lta lags so //
translated: that is so,

original: bde par gshegs pa /🔽de de lta lags te; bdag tu bgyi ba dang bdag gir bgyi bas sems can rnams kun du rgyug cing /
analyzed: bde par gshegs pa / de de lta lags te; bdag tu bgyi ba dang bdag gir bgyi bas sems can rnams kun du rgyug cing /
translated: Sugata, that is so.

original: kun du 'khor bar gyur to //
analyzed: kun du 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: Sentient beings run around and circle in saṃsāra because of the self and what belongs to the self.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, thus sentient beings are defiled.

original: gang la bdag tu bya ba med pa dang / bdag gir bya ba med pa de la 'dzin pa med /
analyzed: gang la bdag tu bya ba med pa dang / bdag gir bya ba med pa de la 'dzin pa med /
translated: Where there is no self and no mine, there is no grasping.

original: gang la 'dzin pa med pa de la sems can kun tu rgyug cing /🔽kun tu 'khor ba med de /
analyzed: gang la 'dzin pa med pa de la sems can kun tu rgyug cing / kun tu 'khor ba med de /
translated: Where there is no grasping, there is no running and no circling of sentient beings.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yang med pas /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yang med pas /
translated: Where there is no running and no circling, there is no defilement.🔽Subhūti, in this way, the purification of sentient beings does exist.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na sems can rnams kyi rnam par byang ba yod pa yin no //
translated: ” The Lord having said this,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: the venerable Subhūti said to him, “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice like this,

original: gzugs la mi spyod /🔽tshor ba la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs la mi spyod / tshor ba la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in form,🔽they do not practice in feeling,

original: 'du shes la mi spyod /
analyzed: 'du shes la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in perception,

original: 'du byed la mi spyod /
analyzed: 'du byed la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in volitional factors,

original: rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
translated: they do not practice in consciousness;

original: mig la mi spyod /
analyzed: mig la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in the eyes,

original: rna ba la mi spyod /🔽sna la mi spyod /
analyzed: rna ba la mi spyod / sna la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in the ears,🔽they do not practice in the nose,

original: lce la mi spyod /
analyzed: lce la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in the tongue,

original: lus la mi spyod /
analyzed: lus la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in the body,

original: yid la mi spyod do //
analyzed: yid la mi spyod do //
translated: they do not practice in the thinking-mind;

original: gzugs la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in a form,

original: sgra la mi spyod /🔽dri la mi spyod /🔽ro la mi spyod /
analyzed: sgra la mi spyod / dri la mi spyod / ro la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in a sound,🔽they do not practice in a smell,

original: reg la mi spyod /
analyzed: reg la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice in a taste,🔽they do not practice in a feeling,

original: chos @269b la mi spyod do //
analyzed: chos @269b la mi spyod do //
translated: they do not engage with phenomena.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /🔽rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mi spyod / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the eye consciousness,🔽they do not engage with the ear consciousness,

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
translated: they do not engage with the nose consciousness,

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
translated: they do not engage with the tongue consciousness,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa la mi spyod; yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa la mi spyod; yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mi spyod do //
translated: they do not engage with the body consciousness, and they do not engage with the mind consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the sensory element of the eyes,🔽they do not engage with the sensory element of sights, and they do not engage with the sensory element of visual consciousness.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the sensory element of the ears,🔽they do not engage with the sensory element of sounds, and they do not engage with the sensory element of auditory consciousness.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the sensory element of the nose,🔽they do not engage with the sensory element of smells, and they do not engage with the sensory element of olfactory consciousness.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the sensory element of the tongue,🔽they do not engage with the sensory element of tastes, and they do not engage with the sensory element of gustatory consciousness.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the sensory element of the body,🔽they do not engage with the sensory element of textures, and they do not engage with the sensory element of tactile consciousness.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not engage with the sensory element of the mental faculty,🔽they do not engage with the sensory element of mental phenomena, and they do not engage with the sensory element of mental consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /🔽rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the sensory element of visual consciousness,🔽they do not engage with the sensory element of auditory consciousness,

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
translated: they do not engage with the sensory element of olfactory consciousness,

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the tongue.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the body.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la mi spyod do //
translated: He does not engage with the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the mind.

original: sa'i khams la mi spyod /
analyzed: sa'i khams la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the earth element.

original: chu'i khams la mi spyod /
analyzed: chu'i khams la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the water element.

original: me'i khams la mi spyod /🔽rlung gi khams la mi spyod /
analyzed: me'i khams la mi spyod / rlung gi khams la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the fire element.🔽He does not engage with the wind element.

original: nam mkha'i khams la mi spyod /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the space element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi spyod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams la mi spyod do //
translated: He does not engage with the consciousness element.

original: ma rig pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: ma rig pa la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with ignorance.

original: 'du byed la mi spyod /
analyzed: 'du byed la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs la mi spyod /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with name and form.

original: skye mched drug la mi spyod /
analyzed: skye mched drug la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the six sense fields.

original: reg pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: reg pa la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with contact.

original: tshor ba la mi spyod /
analyzed: tshor ba la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with feeling.

original: sred pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: sred pa la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with craving.

original: len pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: len pa la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with appropriation.

original: srid pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: srid pa la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with existence.

original: skye ba la mi spyod /
analyzed: skye ba la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with birth.

original: rga shi la mi spyod do //
analyzed: rga shi la mi spyod do //
translated: He does not engage with old age and death.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
translated: He does not engage with the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu @270a *//🔽phyin pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod / bzod pa'i pha rol tu @270a *// phyin pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not practice the perfection of morality,🔽they do not practice the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //🔽nang stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do // nang stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: and they do not practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽They do not practice inner emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice inner and outer emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the emptiness of emptiness,

original: chen po stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice great emptiness,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /🔽'dus byas stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice ultimate emptiness,🔽they do not practice conditioned emptiness,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la mi spyod /🔽mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la mi spyod / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice unconditioned emptiness,🔽they do not practice the emptiness of what is beyond limits,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the emptiness of no beginning and no end,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice the emptiness of nonrepudiation,

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod /🔽mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the emptiness of defining characteristics.🔽They do not engage with the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod /🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la mi spyod / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the emptiness of non-entities.🔽They do not engage with the emptiness of essential nature.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not engage with the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the right efforts.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la mi spyod /🔽dbang po rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la mi spyod / dbang po rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the legs of miraculous power.🔽They do not engage with the faculties.

original: stobs rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: stobs rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the powers.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the branches of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the noble truths.

original: bsam gtan rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the meditative concentrations.

original: tshad med pa rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the immeasurable aspirations.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la mi @270b spyod; rnam par thar pa brgyad la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la mi @270b spyod; rnam par thar pa brgyad la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the eight aspects of liberation.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mi spyod /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la mi spyod /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the clairvoyances.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the meditative stabilities.

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi spyod /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la mi spyod /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the ten powers of the tathāgatas.🔽They do not engage with the four assurances.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi la mi spyod; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la mi spyod /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi la mi spyod; so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the four kinds of exact knowledge.

original: byams pa chen po la mi spyod /
analyzed: byams pa chen po la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with great loving kindness.

original: snying rje chen po la mi spyod /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi spyod /🔽rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la mi spyod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi spyod / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽They do not engage with the result of stream enterer.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la mi spyod /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage with the result of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la mi spyod /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la mi spyod / dgra bcom pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice for the result of non-returning,🔽they do not practice for the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub la mi spyod /
analyzed: rang byang chub la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice for a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la mi spyod /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la mi spyod /
translated: they do not practice for the knowledge of path aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi spyod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi spyod do //
translated: and they do not practice for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang spyod pa dang / gang gis spyod pa dang / gang la spyod par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang spyod pa dang / gang gis spyod pa dang / gang la spyod par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad mi dmigs so //
translated: Because they do not apprehend any dharma at all that practices, by which there is practice, or for which there is practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi thub pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis mi thub pa ste /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing like that cannot be defeated by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing like that cannot be outshone by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de @271a *// ni 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de @271a *// ni 'di ltar 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa'i gnas zil gyis mi non pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon ma mchis pa'i gnas zil gyis mi non pa la gnas pas /
translated: because the bodhisattva is in the stage of irreversibility,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bgyid pa dang ma bral ba ni zil gyis mi non pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bgyid pa dang ma bral ba ni zil gyis mi non pa ste /
translated: the bodhisattva great being who is not separated from keeping in mind the knowledge of all aspects is unassailable.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa lags so //
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar gyur pa lags so //
translated: the bodhisattva great being who practices like that has approached the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gal te dzambu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te dzambu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te /
translated: “Subhūti, if all the beings there are in Jambudvīpa were to obtain a human body at the same time,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa de dag nam 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs pa de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rim gror byas /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur pa de dag nam 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs pa de la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rim gror byas /
translated: and those who have attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment continue to remain for as long as they live, and if some son of enlightened family or daughter of enlightened family were to serve them,🔽revere them,

original: bkur sti byas /🔽phu dud du byas /
analyzed: bkur sti byas / phu dud du byas /
translated: honor them,

original: mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: mchod pa byas te /
translated: and make offerings to them,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
translated: and if they were to dedicate that root of virtue to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think, Subhūti?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: would the merit derived from that cause of those sons of enlightened family or daughters of enlightened family increase much?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,🔽it would increase much, Sugata.

original: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
analyzed: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa mang ngo //
translated: It would increase much.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, if you think that the sons of enlightened family or daughters of enlightened family who have served, revered, honored, and made offerings to those tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas, and who have dedicated the roots of virtue to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, would generate a lot of merit,🔽you should not regard it in that way.

original: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa @271b dang; 'chad pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa @271b dang; 'chad pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, a son of noble family or daughter of noble family who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others, explains it, establishes it,

original: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas rnam par spyod na /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas rnam par spyod na /
translated: expounds it, reveals it, illuminates it, demonstrates it, and practices with attention connected to the perfection of wisdom,

original: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: their merit would increase even more.

original: rab 'byor / gal te gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur te /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in a world system consisting of a four-continent world, however many there are, were to attain a human body,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur la /
translated: and were to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de dag nam 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs pa la /
analyzed: de dag nam 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs pa la /
translated: and were to remain for the duration of their lives,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rim gro byas /🔽bkur sti byas /🔽phu dud byas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rim gro byas / bkur sti byas / phu dud byas /
translated: “Subhūti, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to honor,

original: mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: mchod pa byas te /
translated: revere, respect, and make offerings to🔽as many beings as there are in Jambudvīpa, and

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
translated: dedicate the wholesome root to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think, Subhūti?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate a lot of merit on that basis?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,🔽a lot,

original: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One, a lot.”

original: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others, explains it, makes it clear, makes it clear in detail, reveals it,

original: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang; rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang; rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang /

translated: The Bhagavat said, “Subhūti, a son of a good family or daughter of a good family who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others, explains it, makes it clear, makes it plain, makes it evident, makes it clear in detail,

original: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: and demonstrates it, would generate even more merit than that.”

original: rab 'byor / gal te gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
translated: Subhuti, if all the sentient beings in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm were to attain human bodies, and then some son or daughter of good family were to establish them in the ten virtuous actions, in the four concentrations, in the four immeasurables, in the four formless absorptions,🔽in the five clairvoyances, in the fruit of stream-enterer, in the fruit of once-returner, in the fruit of non-returner, in the fruit of arhatship, in the pratyekabuddha's awakening, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and were to establish them in the fruit of a pratyekabuddha, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu @274a *//
analyzed: de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu @274a *//
translated: and if some son or daughter of good family were to establish a single sentient being in the fruit of a pratyekabuddha, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, the latter would generate merit vastly greater than the former.🔽 Why is that? Because the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of the pratyekabuddhas is dependent on the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of the buddhas.

original: mo la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang /

translated: Subhuti, if all the sentient beings in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm were to attain human bodies, and then some son or daughter of good family were to establish them in the ten virtuous actions, in the four concentrations, in the four immeasurables, in the four formless absorptions,🔽in the five clairvoyances, in the fruit of stream-enterer, in the fruit of once-returner, in the fruit of non-returner, in the fruit of arhatship, in the pratyekabuddha's awakening, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and were to establish them in the fruit of a pratyekabuddha, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽 and if some son or daughter of good family were to establish a single sentient being in the fruit of a pratyekabuddha, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, the latter would generate merit vastly greater than the former.

translated: Why is that? Because the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of the pratyekabuddhas is dependent on the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of the buddhas.🔽 Subhuti, if all the sentient beings in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod de /
