original: rab 'byor / gal te stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in a world system consisting of a triple-thousand great one-thousand worlds were to obtain a human body, and

original: de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish them in the ten virtuous actions, were to establish them in the four concentrations, were to establish them in the four immeasurables, were to establish them in the four formless absorptions,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang; lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang; lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: established in the result of stream enterer, established in the result of once-returner, established in the result of non-returner,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod de /
translated: established in the state of a worthy one, established in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na; rab 'byor /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na; rab 'byor /
translated: and if they were to dedicate that wholesome root to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would the merit of those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family on that account increase much?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,

original: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa; mang ngo //
analyzed: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa; mang ngo //
translated: it would increase much, Sugata, it would increase much.”🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽🔽

original: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston cing 'chad pa @275a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston cing 'chad pa @275a *//
translated: “Subhūti, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others,🔽explains it,🔽establishes it,🔽sets it forth,🔽expounds it,

original: dang; rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na /
analyzed: dang; rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na /
translated: divulges it, and demonstrates it,

original: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: would create even more merit than that.

original: rab 'byor / gal te stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la; de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la; de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab
translated: “Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in a world system of a billion worlds—as many as there are—were to attain a human body, and some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish them in the ten wholesome actions,

original: tu bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: tu bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: and established them in the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: and established them in the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, and the state of a worthy one,

original: rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod de /
analyzed: rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod de /
translated: and established them in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and established them in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
translated: and dedicated that wholesome root to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think, Subhūti?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family on account of that root of merit generate a lot of merit?”

original: gsol pa / @275b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / @275b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,🔽a lot!

original: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One,🔽a lot!”

original: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / rnam par 'grel pa dang /
translated: a son of a good family or daughter of a good family who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others, explains it, establishes them in it, makes them thoroughly understand it,

original: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na /
translated: expounds it,

original: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: and illuminates it will generate even more merit than that.

original: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad snga phyi med par mi'i lus thob par gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, if all the sentient beings in a world system with three thousand worlds—as many as there are—were to obtain a human body, and

original: de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: “If some sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage were to establish them in the ten virtuous ways of action, establish them in the four meditative concentrations, establish them in the four immeasurable aspirations, establish them in the four formless absorptions,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod pa dang /
translated: establish them in the five kinds of supernormal knowledge, establish them in the fruit of entering the stream, establish them in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, establish them in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid la rab tu bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la rab tu bkod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la rab tu bkod de /
translated: establish them in arhatship, establish them in individual enlightenment, and establish them in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla @276a *//
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla @276a *//
translated: and if they were to dedicate that root of virtue to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
translated: and dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think, Subhūti,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam /
translated: would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family on that account generate a lot of merit?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord,🔽a lot,

original: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Well-Gone One, a lot.”

original: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mang ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas kyang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog pa dang / 'grel pa dang /
translated: moreover, a son of a good family or daughter of a good family who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others, explains it, makes it clear,🔽makes it plain, reveals it,

original: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yang dag par ston na /
translated: expounds it, and demonstrates it,

original: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo //
translated: on that account generates even more merit.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: Subhuti : A Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, and who is endowed with this kind of attention, and who thus discriminates, he will soon know full enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that, with attention connected to the knowledge of all aspects, are the recipients of the offerings of all beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam par spyod pa de lta bu ni sems can gang la'ang med de /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de ni 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma gtogs par byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam par spyod pa de lta bu ni sems can gang la'ang med de /
translated: Why is that? Because except for the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas, no being has a bodhisattva great being’s kind of practice.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rigs kyi bu de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Because, Subhūti, when those sons of a good family are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: byams pa chen po mngon par @276b bsgrub ste /
analyzed: byams pa chen po mngon par @276b bsgrub ste /
translated: they accomplish great love.

original: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can thams cad gsad par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar lta ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gsad par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar lta ste /
translated: They are like those who kill all sentient beings.

original: de dag snying rje chen po 'thob bo //🔽de dag rnam par spyod pa des /
analyzed: de dag snying rje chen po 'thob bo // de dag rnam par spyod pa des /
translated: They attain great compassion.🔽They are delighted by that very delight in the practice.

original: rnam par spyod pas dga' bas rab tu dga' ba dang / mngon par dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par spyod pas dga' bas rab tu dga' ba dang / mngon par dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are delighted by that very delight in the practice.

original: de dag dga' ba chen po mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de dag dga' ba chen po mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: They attain great delight.

original: de dag mtshan ma de dang lhan cig tu mi gnas te /
analyzed: de dag mtshan ma de dang lhan cig tu mi gnas te /
translated: They do not dwell together with those signs.

original: de dag btang snyoms chen po 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag btang snyoms chen po 'thob bo //
translated: They attain great equanimity.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab kyi snang ba chen po ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab kyi snang ba chen po ste /
translated: Subhūti, that is the great illumination of the wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: It is the illumination of the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: It is the illumination of the perfection of morality.🔽It is the illumination of the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: It is the illumination of the perfection of perseverance.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: It is the illumination of the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: It is the light of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyang /
translated: “Noble sons, even though they have not fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: they become a gift for all sentient beings,🔽and they do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog go /
translated: Because they practice with attention connected with the perfection of wisdom,🔽they purify the giving of gifts, the giving of gifts of clothes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for sicknesses, and necessary utensils,🔽and they get closer to the knowledge of all aspects.”🔽“Subhūti, what is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings?

original: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the perfection of concentration?🔽What is the perfection of perseverance?🔽What is the perfection of patience?🔽What is the perfection of morality?

original: su'i gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang // nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang / yo byad la yongs su spyod pa'i gtong ba dang / sbyin pa dag gi sbyin pa dag par 'gyur @277a *//
analyzed: su'i gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang // nad kyi rkyen rtsi dang / yo byad la yongs su spyod pa'i gtong ba dang / sbyin pa dag gi sbyin pa dag par 'gyur @277a *//
translated: What is the perfection of giving?”🔽“Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings is the nonapprehension of all dharmas.🔽The perfection of concentration is the nonapprehension of all dharmas.

original: te; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of perseverance is the nonapprehension of all dharmas.🔽The perfection of patience is the nonapprehension of all dharmas.🔽The perfection of morality is the nonapprehension of all dharmas.🔽The perfection of giving is the nonapprehension of all dharmas.🔽“Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings is the nonapprehension of form.🔽The perfection of concentration is the nonapprehension of form.🔽The perfection of perseverance is the nonapprehension of form.🔽The perfection of patience is the nonapprehension of form.🔽The perfection of morality is the nonapprehension of form.🔽The perfection of giving is the nonapprehension of form.🔽“Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings is the nonapprehension of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The perfection of concentration is the nonapprehension of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The perfection of perseverance is the nonapprehension of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The perfection of patience is the nonapprehension of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The perfection of morality is the nonapprehension of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.🔽The perfection of giving is the nonapprehension of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don yod par khams kyi bsod snyoms la yongs su spyod par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lam bstan par 'dod pa dang / snang ba chen po 'byung bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don yod par khams kyi bsod snyoms la yongs su spyod par 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lam bstan par 'dod pa dang / snang ba chen po 'byung bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: who want to produce a great light,

original: khams gsum gyi btson ra na gnas pa'i sems can rnams yongs su dgrol bar 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i shes rab kyi mig bskyed par 'dod pas /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi btson ra na gnas pa'i sems can rnams yongs su dgrol bar 'dod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i shes rab kyi mig bskyed par 'dod pas /
translated: who want to liberate sentient beings who are imprisoned in the three realms, and who want to produce the unsurpassed eye of wisdom in all sentient beings,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rtag tu rgyun mi chad par gnas par bya'o //
translated: should always and continuously abide in the attention that is associated with the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par mi spyod na'ang /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya bas rnam par mi spyod na'ang /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings do not practice with the attention that is associated with the perfection of wisdom,

original: des yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi dbye ste /
analyzed: des yid la bya ba gzhan gyi go skabs mi dbye ste /
translated: they should not open the door to any other kind of attention.

original: des ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba nyid kyis nyin mtshan du mi gtong zhing brtson par gnas pa de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: des ci nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba nyid kyis nyin mtshan du mi gtong zhing brtson par gnas pa de ltar bya'o //
translated: In every way, they should not let go of the perfection of wisdom day or night, and they should apply themselves with attention associated with the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / sngon chad nor bu rin po che rnyed ma myong ba'i skyes bu zhig yod la des dus gzhan zhig na nor bu rin po che rnyed par gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / sngon chad nor bu rin po che rnyed ma myong ba'i skyes bu zhig yod la des dus gzhan zhig na nor bu rin po che rnyed par gyur te /
translated: Suppose there were a person who had never before found a precious jewel, and then at another time they found a precious jewel.

original: des nor bu rin po che de rnyed pas dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / yid bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa las /
analyzed: des nor bu rin po che de rnyed pas dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / yid bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa las /
translated: They would be happy, joyful, and delighted because they had found the precious jewel.

original: des nor bu rin @277b po che de rnyed ma thag tu stor bar gyur na /
analyzed: des nor bu rin @277b po che de rnyed ma thag tu stor bar gyur na /
translated: But as soon as they had found the precious jewel, they lost it.

original: de'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba chen po dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, they would be miserable and have great mental dissatisfaction.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par kyi hud bdag ni yid du 'ong ba'i nor bu rin po che de dang bral bar gyur to zhes nor bu rin po che dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba sha stag rgyun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par kyi hud bdag ni yid du 'ong ba'i nor bu rin po che de dang bral bar gyur to zhes nor bu rin po che dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba sha stag rgyun du 'byung ngo //
translated: He always and constantly thinks, ‘Alas, I have been separated from that delightful precious gem!’ and he is constantly preoccupied with the precious gem.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ni rin po che'i snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ni rin po che'i snyam du bsams te /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, bodhisattva great beings should think, ‘This is a precious gem!’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar bya'o //
translated: and they should not be separated from the attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che de stor bar yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che de stor bar yang mi bya ste /
translated: They should not lose that precious gem, the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar na rtag tu bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rtag tu bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way they will always have much happiness and mental ease.”🔽Subhūti then asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /🔽yid la bgyi ba de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das / yid la bgyi ba de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽all those thoughts are free from intrinsic nature.

original: yid la bgyi ba thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: yid la bgyi ba thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: All those thoughts are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba lags /
translated: How is it that bodhisattva great beings are not separated from the attention associated with the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bral ba la ni byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs /
analyzed: bral ba la ni byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs /
translated: In separation, bodhisattvas are not apprehended,

original: yid la bgyi ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: yid la bgyi ba mi dmigs /
translated: attention is not apprehended,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar chos @278a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar chos @278a *//
translated: “Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings think like this:

original: thams cad ni rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: ‘All dharmas are separated from their intrinsic nature,

original: de ni nyan thos kyis ma byas /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos kyis ma byas / rang sangs rgyas kyis ma byas /
translated: they are not made by śrāvakas,🔽they are not made by pratyekabuddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang ma mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang ma mdzad de /
translated: and they are not made by the lord buddhas,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' 'di ni gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' 'di ni gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba yin te /
translated: If they know that the dharmatā of phenomena, the establishment of phenomena, the faultlessness of phenomena, thusness, unaltered thusness, the establishment of phenomena, the dharma-constituent, and the very limit of reality are a stable state, then those bodhisattva great beings are not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin gyis dben /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin gyis dben /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom is empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste /
translated: It is empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: de la 'phel ba med do //
analyzed: de la 'phel ba med do //
translated: It does not increase.

original: yongs su 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa med do //
translated: It does not decrease.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” “Lord,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na /
translated: if the perfection of wisdom is empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par byung zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par byung zhing /
translated: How do bodhisattva great beings emerge from the perfection of wisdom

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @278b dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par byung yang 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems @278b dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par byung yang 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med de /
translated: “Su­bhūti, although bodhisattva great beings emerge from the perfection of wisdom, there is no increase or decrease.

original: de bzhin nyid la 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do; ;chos kyi dbyings la 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do; ;chos kyi dbyings la 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do //
translated: There is no increase or decrease in suchness. There is no increase or decrease in the expanse of reality.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la 'phel ba'am yongs su 'grib pa med do //
translated: There is no increase or decrease in the very limit of reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gcig kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gcig kyang ma yin /
translated: If you ask why,

original: gnyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is neither one nor two.

original: rab 'byor / gal te de skad du bshad pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te de skad du bshad pa la /
translated: Subhuti, if you explain it like this,🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'jum mi 'gong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'jum mi 'gong /
translated: Subhūti, if a bodhisattva great being does not get discouraged, does not get cowed,

original: mi 'jigs mi dngang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs mi dngang /
translated: does not get frightened, does not get scared,🔽does not tremble, does not shake, does not quiver,

original: skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbyings la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: skrag par mi 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i dbyings la gnas pa ste /
translated: when this is being taught, then you should know that bodhisattva great being is standing in the irreversible element,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o ////
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya bar rtogs par rig par bya'o ////
translated: and that bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya zhe bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya zhe bzhi pa /
translated: Volume 24

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / gsog nyid dang / gsob nyid dang / rag lus pa nyid dang / snying po ma mchis pa gang lags pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / gsog nyid dang / gsob nyid dang / rag lus pa nyid dang / snying po ma mchis pa gang lags pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
translated: does the emptiness, hollowness, falsity, unreality, and essencelessness of the perfection of wisdom practice the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, that is not so.”

original: gsol pa / @279a *//
analyzed: gsol pa / @279a *//
translated: He said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos gang yang dmigs su mchis sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i chos gang yang dmigs su mchis sam /
translated: is there any phenomenon whatsoever that is observed apart from the perfection of wisdom in which one might practice the perfection of wisdom?”

translated: Is the emptiness of the condition of the tongue, the signless, the wishless, the unconditioned, the unelaborated, the non-arisen, the non-ceased, the tainted, the untainted, the conditioned, and the unconditioned practiced in the perfection of wisdom?🔽Is the emptiness of the condition of the tongue, the signless, the wishless, the unconditioned, the unelaborated, the non-arisen, the non-ceased, the tainted, the untainted, the conditioned, and the unconditioned practiced in the perfection of wisdom?

translated: Does the suchness that is not other, the true nature, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, and the inconceivable expanse practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: Does the suchness that is not other, the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, and the inconceivable expanse practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci lags / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / gsog nyid dang / gsob nyid dang / rag lus pa nyid dang // snying po ma mchis pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang /

translated: Blessed One,🔽is it the emptiness of the perfection of concentration, its being void, its being a falsehood, its hollow nature, its insubstantiality, its suchness, its unaltered suchness,

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos kyi gnas nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab @295a *//

translated: its unmistaken suchness, its inalienable suchness, its true nature, its dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, and the inconceivable expanse that practices the perfection of wisdom?

original: pa'i dbyings de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: pa'i dbyings de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

translated: “There is no such possibility that they will not attain the great gnosis of the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, the gnosis of a knower of all aspects.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phyir te /

translated: Those dharmas of theirs will never decrease until they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti said, “Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @306b pa ni shin tu dben pa'i slad du mkhas shing rig pas rtogs par bgyi ba'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: those beings who listen to this profound perfection of wisdom, who take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and practice it as it is taught,

translated: and who do not let other mental states and events interrupt their practice until they fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, they do not possess the lowest wholesome roots.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: de de bzhin te /

original: sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan cing 'dzin pa dang / 'chang zhing klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed cing /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du /

translated: “Kauśika, those beings who listen to this deep perfection of wisdom, take it up, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and properly pay attention to it,🔽and who do not let any other mental factors and events intervene until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gyi go mi 'byed pa de dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba tha ma dang ldan pa ma yin no //

original: koo shi ka /

analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /

original: pa lnga dang ldan par gyur la /

analyzed: bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //

analyzed: grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do // de nas dge slong gcig gis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: It is not even possible to calculate it with an analogy.”🔽Then a certain monk said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika,

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang ldan pa /

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the four immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the four formless absorptions,

analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag thams cad ni /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi g-yeng ba'i sems kyis 'dzin pa dang / @307b 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang /
translated: and if all those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family were to take up this deep perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, and properly pay attention to it with an undistracted mind,

analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed cing /
translated: They should be diligent in suchness,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gyi go mi 'byed pa de dag gis zil gyis non to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan gyi go mi 'byed pa de dag gis zil gyis non to //

analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis dge slong de la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the bhikṣu,
