translated: “Bhikṣu, the beings of Jambudvīpa who possess the path of the ten virtuous actions,🔽who possess the four concentrations,🔽who possess the four immeasurable aspirations,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: and who possess the four formless absorptions

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems dang po bskyed pas kyang zil gyis non na /🔽gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bzung zhing bcangs te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems dang po bskyed pas kyang zil gyis non na / gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa dang / bzung zhing bcangs te /
translated: “If all those who have the five superknowledges are outshone by the bodhisattva great beings who have produced the first thought of awakening endowed with the knowledge of all aspects,🔽what need is there to say more about those who take up this deep perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud, master it, pay proper attention to it, take it up, bear it in mind,

original: klags shing kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: klags shing kun chub par byas nas kyang de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: read it aloud, master it, and then practice it just as it is taught?

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
translated: They will outshine the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des ni /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing @308a *//
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing @308a *//
translated: will outshine the world with its gods, humans, and asuras

original: 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and go forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing 'gro bar yang ma zad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing 'gro bar yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only does that bodhisattva great being surpass the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang zil gyis mnan cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang zil gyis mnan cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but that bodhisattva great being also surpasses all the stream enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su'ang ma zad de /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su'ang ma zad de /
translated: Not only does that bodhisattva great being surpass the stream enterers, once-returners, non-returners, arhats, and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
translated: but that bodhisattva great being also surpasses the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of generosity without skill in means,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
translated: and all those who are without the perfection of wisdom will be surpassed and left behind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
translated: “Not only that, but also, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving surpass and leave behind all those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of morality who are without skillful means

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad @308b de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad @308b de /
translated: and are without the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
translated: “Not only that, but also, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving surpass and leave behind all those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of patience who are without skillful means🔽and are without the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
translated: and all those who are without the perfection of wisdom will be surpassed and left behind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
translated: “Not only that, but also, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of patience surpass and leave behind all those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of perseverance who are without skillful means

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
translated: and are without the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: “Not only that, but also, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of perseverance surpass and leave behind all those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of concentration who are without skillful means🔽and are without the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba /
translated: “Not only that, but also, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of concentration surpass and leave behind all those bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who are without skillful means🔽and are without the perfection of concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang zil gyis gnon cing 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also surpass all those who are without the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only will they practice the perfection of concentration,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du spyod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: but also those bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi zil gyis gnon par mi nus so //
translated: will surpass the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @309a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @309a *//
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad du bstan pa dang mthun par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji skad du bstan pa dang mthun par spyod pa ste /
translated: who practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught🔽will surpass the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rigs rgyun mi gcad pa'i don du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rigs rgyun mi gcad pa'i don du gnas pa'o //
translated: “This bodhisattva mahāsattva is established for the purpose of not cutting off the family of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rgyang ring du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rgyang ring du mi byed pa'o //
translated: “This bodhisattva mahāsattva does not keep the tathāgatas at a distance.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni snying po byang chub las 'phang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni snying po byang chub las 'phang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who has set out in that way will not fall from the site of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: “This bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: sems can bying ba rnams 'don par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can bying ba rnams 'don par 'dod pa'o //
translated: wants to rescue beings who are sinking.

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who trains like that

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la slob pa ste /
translated: trains in the bodhisattva training.

original: nyan thos kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not train in the śrāvaka training.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bslab pa la slob pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not train in the pratyekabuddha training.

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi dag kyang 'gro bar bya bar sems te /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi dag kyang 'gro bar bya bar sems te /
translated: The four great kings think that they should go into the presence of the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is training in that way.

original: nye bar 'dong zhing 'di skad ces smra'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'dong zhing 'di skad ces smra'o //
translated: They approach and say, ‘Oh, great being, train quickly!

original: kye skyes bu chen po myur du slobs shig /🔽skyes bu chen po skyen par slobs shig /
analyzed: kye skyes bu chen po myur du slobs shig / skyes bu chen po skyen par slobs shig /
translated: Oh, great being, train swiftly!

original: lhung bzed bzhi po 'di dag ni khyod kyis snying po byang chub tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed bzhi po 'di dag ni khyod kyis snying po byang chub tu 'dug ste /
translated: These four alms bowls are for you to sit on at the site of awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs @309b rgyas nas blang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs @309b rgyas nas blang bar bya ba ste /
translated: You should take them up after you have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di dag ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bzhes pa'o zhes zer zhing ston to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bzhes pa'o zhes zer zhing ston to //
translated: They were used by the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas of the past.’

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi dag kyang /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du rgyal po chen po bzhi dag kyang /
translated: “The four great kings, too, will think to approach the bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom like that,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'dong bar sems so; ;de'i drung du bdag kyang sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so /🔽lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe ma'am mtshe ma'i lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so; ;lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan yang dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //🔽lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga' yang 'phrul dga'i lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'dong bar sems so; ;de'i drung du bdag kyang sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so / lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe ma'am mtshe ma'i lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so; ;lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan yang dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so // lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga' yang 'phrul dga'i lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
translated: together with the sons of the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings. I, too, will think to approach him, together with the sons of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.🔽The king of the gods Suyāma will think to approach him, together with the sons of the gods of the Heaven of Yāma.🔽The king of the gods Santuṣita will think to approach him, together with the sons of the gods of the Heaven of Joy.🔽The king of the gods Sunirmita will think to approach him, together with the sons of the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations.

original: lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur yang gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur yang gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //
translated: The king of the gods Vaśavartin will think to approach him, together with the sons of the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations.

original: tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po 'ang tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so //🔽kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
analyzed: tshangs pa mi mjed kyi bdag po 'ang tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang lhan cig 'gro bar sems so // kun snang dang ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
translated: Brahma, lord of the Sahā world, will also think to go there, together with the sons of the gods of the Brahma group.

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //🔽'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so // 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
translated: The gods of the Śubhakṛtsna realm will also think to go there.🔽The gods of the Bṛhatphala realm will also think to go there.

original: mi che ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //🔽mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
analyzed: mi che ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so // mi gdung ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
translated: The gods of the Atapa realm will also think to go there.🔽The gods of the Sudṛśa realm will also think to go there.🔽The gods of the Sudarśana realm will also think to go there.

original: shin @310a *// tu mthong ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //🔽gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
analyzed: shin @310a *// tu mthong ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so // gya nom snang ba'i lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
translated: The gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm will also think to go there.🔽The gods of the Śubhakṛtsna realm will also think to go there.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams kyang nye bar 'dong bar sems so //
translated: The gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm will also think to go there.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang rtag tu dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang rtag tu dgongs pa yin te /
translated: are constantly contemplated by the thus-gone ones.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la de ltar spyod pa de'i lus la ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la de ltar spyod pa de'i lus la ni /
translated: For those bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom in that way,

original: 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa gang ji snyed cig lus la 'byung ba de dag kyang thams cad du thams cad lus la mi 'byung mi 'bab ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa gang ji snyed cig lus la 'byung ba de dag kyang thams cad du thams cad lus la mi 'byung mi 'bab ste /
translated: no worldly suffering caused by others will occur or befall their bodies.

original: dge slong de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dge slong de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: That monk, when practicing this profound perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di'i yon tan du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i yon tan du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: will have these qualities.🔽Whatever worldly illnesses there are, such as

original: 'dus pa'i nad rnams gang ji snyed pa 'di lta ste; mig gi nad dam /🔽rna ba'i nad dam /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i nad rnams gang ji snyed pa 'di lta ste; mig gi nad dam / rna ba'i nad dam /
translated: eye diseases,🔽ear diseases,

original: sna'i nad dam /
analyzed: sna'i nad dam /
translated: nose diseases,

original: lce'i nad dam /
analyzed: lce'i nad dam /
translated: or tongue disease,

original: lus kyi nad dam /
analyzed: lus kyi nad dam /
translated: or body disease,

original: snying gi nad gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang lus la mi 'byung mi 'bab ste /🔽'di dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: snying gi nad gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang lus la mi 'byung mi 'bab ste / 'di dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: or heart disease, whatever they may be, will not occur or descend upon the body.

original: 'di'i yon tan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yon tan du rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be known as the qualities of the bodhisattva great beings who practice this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa @310b dga' bo 'di snyam du gyur te /🔽lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di rang gi spobs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa @310b dga' bo 'di snyam du gyur te / lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di rang gi spobs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing /
translated: Then the venerable Nanda thought this:🔽“Does Śatakratu, head of the gods, teach the perfection of wisdom with his own inspiration,🔽or does he teach it through the power of the Buddha?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang legs pa brjod dam; 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston snyam pa dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang legs pa brjod dam; 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston snyam pa dang / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, understood in his mind the venerable Nanda’s thought and said this to the venerable Nanda:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: btsun pa dga' bo /
analyzed: btsun pa dga' bo /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda,

original: bdag de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang legs pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bdag de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan dang legs pa brjod pa ni /
translated: I know that the one who teaches the perfection of wisdom and describes the qualities and benefits of the perfection of wisdom

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthur rig par bya'o //
translated: is the power of the Buddha.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: ” Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: dga' bo / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' bo / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Ānanda, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te; lha'i dbang po brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan dang / legs pa brjod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin te; lha'i dbang po brgya byin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i yon tan dang / legs pa brjod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: It is so! The one who teaches this profound perfection of wisdom and describes the qualities and benefits of this perfection of wisdom is the power of the Tathāgata.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: That is the blessing of the Tathāgata.

original: dga' bo / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dga' bo / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgom pa de'i tshe /
translated: “Ānanda, when bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom, strive at the perfection of wisdom, and cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bdud sdig to @311a *//
analyzed: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bdud sdig to @311a *//
translated: then all the māras, the evil ones, in the great trichiliocosm,

original: can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas te /
analyzed: can gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad ci byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byas te /
translated: will think, ‘Will this bodhisattva great being realize the very limit of reality and

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: attain the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, and individual enlightenment,

original: 'on te ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin gyi /
translated: or will he not?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur snyam ste /
translated: He will think, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: dogs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dogs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will have doubts.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: “ Nanda, moreover, when a bodhisattva great being is not separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud sdig to can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud sdig to can mya ngan gyi zug rngus zug par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the evil Māra will be pierced by the pain of grief.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “ Nanda, moreover, when a bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud sdig to can ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa las sems gcig tsam 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang / zhum par 'gyur ba dang / spu g-yo bar 'gyur bar skar mda' ltung bar gtong zhing 'jigs pa bskyed do //
analyzed: bdud sdig to can ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa las sems gcig tsam 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang / zhum par 'gyur ba dang / spu g-yo bar 'gyur bar skar mda' ltung bar gtong zhing 'jigs pa bskyed do //
translated: Māra, the evil one, will send down meteors and create fear so that the mind of a bodhisattva great being may be disturbed even for a single moment, so that he may be made to despair, so that his hair may stand on end, and so that he may turn away from the attention to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Nanda said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ci lags / @311b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas mchi bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci lags / @311b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas mchi bar 'gyur ram /
translated: will Māra, the evil one, approach all bodhisattva great beings with the intention to harm?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas 'ong ba ma yin no //
translated: “Nanda, Māra, the evil one, does not approach all bodhisattva great beings with the intention to harm.

original: dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: Nanda said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: 'o na ji lta bu'i drung du mchi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu'i drung du mchi bar 'gyur /
translated: “Well then, in whose presence will they come to be?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sngon gyi mthar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sngon gyi mthar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: “Nanda, when a bodhisattva has not developed interest in this profound perfection of wisdom when it was being taught in the past,

original: sems mos par ma byas pa de'i drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'ong ngo //
analyzed: sems mos par ma byas pa de'i drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'ong ngo //
translated: then Māra, the evil one, will approach them with the intention to harm.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: “Moreover, Nanda, when a bodhisattva has doubts about this profound perfection of wisdom when it is being taught,

original: 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin nam /
translated: wondering whether it is the perfection of wisdom

original: 'on tam ma yin zhes the tshom du gyur pa de dag gi drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'ong ngo //
analyzed: 'on tam ma yin zhes the tshom du gyur pa de dag gi drung du bdud sdig to can gtse ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'ong ngo //
translated: or not, then Māra, the evil one, will approach them with the intention to harm.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral na /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral na /
translated: “Moreover, Nanda, when a bodhisattva is separated from a spiritual friend

original: des dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi mthong bas /
analyzed: des dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi mthong bas /
translated: and does not see a spiritual friend,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi thos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di mi thos so //
translated: They do not hear this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: ma thos pas mi shes so //
analyzed: ma thos pas mi shes so //
translated: Not hearing it, they do not know it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar bsgom pa ma shes pas de bzhin nyid du nan tan mi byed do //🔽dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis @312a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar bsgom pa ma shes pas de bzhin nyid du nan tan mi byed do // dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis @312a *//
translated: Not knowing how to cultivate the perfection of wisdom, they do not practice accordingly.

original: glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, Māra the evil one will find an opportunity with regard to those bodhisattvas.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral la /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral la /
translated: Nanda, moreover, if bodhisattvas are separated from the perfection of wisdom

original: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa yongs su 'dzin pa byed na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa yongs su 'dzin pa byed na /
translated: and engage in upholding what is not the true Dharma,

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, Māra the evil one will find an opportunity with regard to those bodhisattvas.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i chos ma yin pa la bsngags pa brjod na /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dam pa'i chos ma yin pa la bsngags pa brjod na /
translated: Nanda, moreover, if bodhisattvas who are separated from the perfection of wisdom praise what is not the true Dharma,

original: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Māra the evil one will think this:

original: gang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa'i bsngags pa smra ba ni bdag gi grogs yin te /
analyzed: gang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa'i bsngags pa smra ba ni bdag gi grogs yin te /
translated: Those who praise what is not the true Dharma are my friends.

original: gang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa'i bsngags pa smra ba 'di ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa mang po'i nang nas /
analyzed: gang dam pa'i chos ma yin pa'i bsngags pa smra ba 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa mang po'i nang nas /
translated: Those who praise what is not the true Dharma

original: bdag gis grogs su rnyed pa ste /🔽de ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa 'di lta ste /🔽nyan thos kyi sa dang; rang sangs rgyas kyi sa gnyis las gcig tu gnas par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gis grogs su rnyed pa ste / de ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa 'di lta ste / nyan thos kyi sa dang; rang sangs rgyas kyi sa gnyis las gcig tu gnas par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: are friends I have found among the many followers of the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.🔽In that way, I will be able to complete my intention🔽that this person who is a follower of the vehicle of the bodhisattvas should be fixed on one of the two levels,

original: de bdag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o snyam ste /
analyzed: de bdag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o snyam ste /
translated: namely, the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.’

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Nanda, Māra the evil one will find an opportunity to harm that bodhisattva.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu la bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu la bdud kyis glags rnyed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “Nanda, moreover, how will Māra the evil one find an opportunity to harm a bodhisattva?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: When a bodhisattva is taught this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu zab ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shin tu zab ste /
translated: He will say, The perfection of wisdom is very deep.

original: khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @312b 'di thos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @312b 'di thos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What will you do by hearing this deep perfection of wisdom?

original: bsgoms pa dang bzung ba dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pas kyang ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bsgoms pa dang bzung ba dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pas kyang ci zhig bya /
translated: What will you do by meditating on it, by taking it up, by reading it, by mastering it?

original: ngas kyang de'i gting ma rnyed na /🔽khyod kyis lta rnyed re skan zhes zer na /
analyzed: ngas kyang de'i gting ma rnyed na / khyod kyis lta rnyed re skan zhes zer na /
translated: I myself have not found its depths.🔽How could you find them?

original: dga' bo; byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo; byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mara, the Evil One, will find an opportunity with that bodhisattva, Nanda.🔽 Moreover, Nanda, when a bodhisattva great being generates a bodhisattva in another, thinking, I practice the perfection of generosity,🔽I practice the perfection of moral discipline,🔽I practice the perfection of patience,🔽I practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' brnyes par skyed cing /🔽nga ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan la byang chub sems dpa' brnyes par skyed cing / nga ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: I practice the perfection of concentration,🔽I practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽I practice the perfection of skillful means,🔽I practice the perfection of aspiration,🔽I practice the perfection of power,

original: nga ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nga ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: I practice the perfection of knowledge,🔽I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽I will liberate beings who have not been liberated,🔽I will release beings who have not been released,🔽I will bring to peace beings who have not been brought to peace,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,🔽I will bring to nirvana beings who have not attained nirvana,

original: nga ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o; ;nga ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nga ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o; ;nga ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: I am practicing the perfection of diligence.

original: nga ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nga ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: I am practicing the perfection of concentration.

original: nga ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o /
analyzed: nga ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o /
translated: I am practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: khyod ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: You are not practicing the perfection of generosity.

original: khyod ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //🔽khyod ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no // khyod ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: You are not practicing the perfection of discipline.🔽You are not practicing the perfection of patience.

original: khyod ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: You are not practicing the perfection of diligence.

original: khyod ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no //
translated: You are not practicing the perfection of concentration.

original: khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes rlom sems su byed na /
analyzed: khyod ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes rlom sems su byed na /
translated: You are not practicing the perfection of wisdom.’

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, Mara, the evil one, will find an opportunity to harm that bodhisattva.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' bdag @313a *//
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' bdag @313a *//
translated: Moreover, Nanda, when a bodhisattva generates pride,

original: nyid mchog tu rlom sems bskyed na /
analyzed: nyid mchog tu rlom sems bskyed na /
translated: thinking himself superior,

original: dga' bo / de'i tshe bdud sdig to can dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / nyams bde ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / tshim zhing yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo / de'i tshe bdud sdig to can dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / nyams bde ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / tshim zhing yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, at that time Mara, the evil one, will be delighted, joyful, pleased, and overjoyed.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro //🔽dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' de la'ang bdud sdig to can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ro // dga' bo / gzhan yang gang gi tshe /
translated: Nanda, Mara, the evil one, will find an opportunity to harm that bodhisattva.🔽Moreover, Nanda, when a bodhisattva

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming brjod pa'am /🔽rus brjod pa kun tu grags par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming brjod pa'am / rus brjod pa kun tu grags par gyur na /
translated: is renowned for his name🔽and his clan,

original: de ming brjod pa 'am rus brjod pa des /
analyzed: de ming brjod pa 'am rus brjod pa des /
translated: through that fame of his name and clan,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dge ba'i chos can dag khyad du gsod cing bdag bstod gzhan smod la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dge ba'i chos can dag khyad du gsod cing bdag bstod gzhan smod la /
translated: that bodhisattva will disparage other bodhisattva great beings who have virtuous qualities, praising himself and disparaging others.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan mar bya ba'i yon tan de dag kyang de la med par rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma de dag gis nyon mongs pa bskyed cing bdag bstod gzhan smod de /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan mar bya ba'i yon tan de dag kyang de la med par rnam pa dang / tshul dang / mtshan ma de dag gis nyon mongs pa bskyed cing bdag bstod gzhan smod de /
translated: With those aspects, modes, and signs, they generate afflictions, praise themselves, and disparage others.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar nga byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas par snang ba de ltar khyod byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gnas par mi snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar nga byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas par snang ba de ltar khyod byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gnas par mi snang ngo //
translated: They say, ‘You do not appear to be abiding in the Bodhisattva Vehicle and in the Bodhisattva family as I appear to be abiding in the Bodhisattva Vehicle and in the Bodhisattva family.🔽You do not appear to be abiding in the Bodhisattva family.’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas par mi snang ngo zhes de de ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag la mi snyan par brjod cing smod na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs la gnas par mi snang ngo zhes de de ltar gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa de dag la mi snyan par brjod cing smod na /
translated: When they disparage and criticize those individuals who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle like that,

original: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Māra, the evil one, thinks,

original: bdag gi gnas ni stongs @313b par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi gnas ni stongs @313b par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘My realm will not be emptied.’

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dvags kyi yul yang shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes ci nas kyang de'i tshig gzung du rung bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bdud sdig to can byang chub sems dpa' de byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dvags kyi yul yang shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes ci nas kyang de'i tshig gzung du rung bar 'gyur ba de lta de ltar bdud sdig to can byang chub sems dpa' de byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: The great hells, the animal realms, the worlds of Yama, and the worlds of hungry ghosts will all increase greatly.

original: de'i tshig bzung du rung bas skye bo mang po dag kyang mnyan pa dang / yid ches par bya bar sems te /🔽de la de dag gis thos sam /
analyzed: de'i tshig bzung du rung bas skye bo mang po dag kyang mnyan pa dang / yid ches par bya bar sems te / de la de dag gis thos sam /
translated: In this way, the evil Māra will bless the bodhisattva so that his words will be accepted by many people, and they will listen to him and believe him.

original: mthong na mthun par spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong na mthun par spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: When they hear or see him, they will follow his example.

original: de dag gis thos sam mthong nas mthun par spyod cing de bzhin du slob ste /
analyzed: de dag gis thos sam mthong nas mthun par spyod cing de bzhin du slob ste /
translated: When they hear or see him, they will follow his example and train accordingly.

original: de dag de bzhin nyid du slob cing de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de dag de bzhin nyid du slob cing de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When they train accordingly and practice accordingly,

original: nyon mongs pa shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: their afflictions will increase greatly.

original: de ltar de dag bsam pa phyin ci log du gyur pas /
analyzed: de ltar de dag bsam pa phyin ci log du gyur pas /
translated: In this way, their intentions will become distorted.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis las gang dang gang brtsams pa de thams cad mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid du mi 'ong bar 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis las gang dang gang brtsams pa de thams cad mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid du mi 'ong bar 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever actions they undertake physically, verbally, or mentally will all be accomplished in undesirable, unpleasant, and disagreeable ways.

original: de ltar na sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag kyang rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can dmyal ba chen po de dag kyang rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur /
translated: In this way, the great hells will increase.

original: byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dvags kyi yul yang rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / yi dvags kyi yul yang rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: The animal realms, the world of Yama, and the world of hungry ghosts will also increase.

original: bdud kyi gnas kyang shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: bdud kyi gnas kyang shin tu 'phel bar 'gyur bas /
translated: The realm of Māra will also greatly increase.

original: dga' bo / don gyi dbang de mthong nas /
analyzed: dga' bo / don gyi dbang de mthong nas /
translated: Nandō, seeing this power of the truth,

original: bdud sdig to can dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / tshim pa dang / yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽dga' bo / gzhan yang gal te gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg @314a *//
analyzed: bdud sdig to can dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / tshim pa dang / yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro // dga' bo / gzhan yang gal te gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg @314a *//
translated: the evil Māra will be delighted, joyful, satisfied, and content.

original: pa pa gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang rtsod cing /
analyzed: pa pa gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang rtsod cing /
translated: “Nandō, moreover, if a person of the Bodhisattva Vehicle argues with a person of the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: nga ni mchog tu gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nga ni mchog tu gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: saying, ‘I am superior,

original: khyod ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: khyod ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: you are not,’

original: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Māra the wicked one thinks,

original: kye rigs kyi bu 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ring du byed pa ste /
analyzed: kye rigs kyi bu 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ring du byed pa ste /
translated: ‘Alas, this son of a good family is far from the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang nye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: He is not approaching the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'thab mo dang / 'khrug pa dang / rtsod pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ma yin te /
analyzed: 'thab mo dang / 'khrug pa dang / rtsod pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba 'di dag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ma yin te /
translated: These quarrels, fights, disputes, and arguments are not the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ni sems can dmyal ba'i lam mo //🔽de ni byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de ni sems can dmyal ba'i lam mo // de ni byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam mo //
translated: This is the path to the hells.🔽This is the path to the animal world.

original: de ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam mo //
analyzed: de ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam mo //
translated: This is the path to the world of Yama.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam ma yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam ma yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is not the path to the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa can gzhan du 'thab cing rtsod la /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang / gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa can gzhan du 'thab cing rtsod la /
translated: ‘Moreover, Nanda, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva and another bodhisattva mahāsattva quarrel, fight, dispute, and argue,

original: 'khrug cing mtshang 'dru na /
analyzed: 'khrug cing mtshang 'dru na /
translated: If they quarrel and reprove each other,

original: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te; 'di gnyis ka'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ring du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdud sdig to can 'di snyam du sems te; 'di gnyis ka'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ring du byed pa'o //
translated: then Māra the wicked one thinks, ‘Both of these are far from the knowledge of all aspects.🔽Neither of these will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di gnyis ka'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis gang brtsams pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis gang brtsams pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ma yin /
translated: Because the path that these two sons of a good family have undertaken is not the path to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis ni sems @314b can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam brtsams so zhes nas dga' zhing spro ba dang / tshim zhing yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di gnyis kyis ni sems @314b can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam brtsams so zhes nas dga' zhing spro ba dang / tshim zhing yid bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These two sons of a good family have undertaken the path to the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama.’ And he becomes joyful, elated, satisfied, and delighted.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' lung ma bstan pa /
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang gal te byang chub sems dpa' lung ma bstan pa /
translated: “Moreover, Nanda, if a bodhisattva who has not received a prophecy

original: byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa la gnod par sems shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa la gnod par sems shing /
translated: “If bodhisattvas think that the predictions are harmful,

original: 'thab cing rtsod la 'khrug cing mtshang 'dru na /
analyzed: 'thab cing rtsod la 'khrug cing mtshang 'dru na /
translated: and if they fight, argue, quarrel, and dispute,

original: gal te des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi btang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi btang zhe na /
translated: then, if they do not give up the knowledge of all aspects,

original: ci tsam du sdig pa'i sems bskyed pa skyes pa dang / 'thab cing rtsod pa dang / 'khrug cing mtshang 'dru bar gyur ba de srid kyi bskal par go cha bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci tsam du sdig pa'i sems bskyed pa skyes pa dang / 'thab cing rtsod pa dang / 'khrug cing mtshang 'dru bar gyur ba de srid kyi bskal par go cha bgo bar bya'o //
translated: they should don the armor for as many eons as they have given rise to evil thoughts, fought, argued, quarreled, and disputed.”

original: dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: Nanda said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: dedag gi sems bskyed pa de dag la 'byung ba gzhan mchis sam /
analyzed: dedag gi sems bskyed pa de dag la 'byung ba gzhan mchis sam /
translated: are there other things that arise from those thoughts that they give rise to,

original: 'on te ma lags kyi; bskal pa de snyed kho nar go cha bgo 'chal /
analyzed: 'on te ma lags kyi; bskal pa de snyed kho nar go cha bgo 'chal /
translated: or do they have to don the armor for exactly that many eons?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: dga' bo / gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la ngas 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: dga' bo / gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams la ngas 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: Nanda, I have taught the Dharma with its arising to those persons who are in the vehicle of the hearers, those who are in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and those who are in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: dga' bo / de la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa /
analyzed: dga' bo / de la gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa /
translated: Nanda, in that regard, a person who is in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag dang 'thab cing rtsod la gshe zhing mi snyan du brjod pa dang / 'thab cing rtsod de gshe ba dang / mi snyan par brjod pa byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag dang 'thab cing rtsod la gshe zhing mi snyan du brjod pa dang / 'thab cing rtsod de gshe ba dang / mi snyan par brjod pa byas nas /
translated: who quarrels, disputes, and argues with a person who is in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, and who, having quarreled, disputed, and argued,

original: phyir mi chags @315a *//
analyzed: phyir mi chags @315a *//
translated: does not let go of his anger,

original: par mdud par 'dzin cing khon du gzung ste gnas na /
analyzed: par mdud par 'dzin cing khon du gzung ste gnas na /
translated: but holds on to it and bears a grudge,

original: dga' bo / gang zag de ni 'byung bar nga mi smra ste /
analyzed: dga' bo / gang zag de ni 'byung bar nga mi smra ste /
translated: Nanda, I do not say that such a person will arise again.

original: gang zag des gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi btang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag des gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi btang zhe na /
translated: If such a person does not give up the knowledge of all aspects,

original: gdon mi za bar bskal ba de snyed du go cha bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bskal ba de snyed du go cha bgo bar bya'o //
translated: then without a doubt he must don the armor for that many eons.

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang 'thab cing rtsod de gshe ba dang mi snyan par brjod par gyur na'ang /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang 'thab cing rtsod de gshe ba dang mi snyan par brjod par gyur na'ang /
translated: Nanda, if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, while quarreling, disputing, and speaking harshly and unpleasantly,

original: mdud par mi 'dzin la phyin chad sdom pa 'dzin cing /
analyzed: mdud par mi 'dzin la phyin chad sdom pa 'dzin cing /
translated: does not hold grudges and henceforth maintains restraint,

original: bdag gis ni thob par bya ba nyes par thob ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ni thob par bya ba nyes par thob ste /
translated: thinking, I have wrongly obtained what should be obtained,

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal dgos na /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal dgos na /
translated: because I must dispel the suffering of all sentient beings,

original: de ltar bdag smras pa la phyir smra ba dang / bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi zam par gyur par bya dgos na /
analyzed: de ltar bdag smras pa la phyir smra ba dang / bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi zam par gyur par bya dgos na /
translated: and if I must become a bridge for all sentient beings,

original: de ltar na bdag gzhan la mi snyan par smra zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag gzhan la mi snyan par smra zhing /
translated: then it is not right for me to speak unpleasantly to others

original: phyir zlogs pa ni mi tshul gyis /
analyzed: phyir zlogs pa ni mi tshul gyis /
translated: and turn them away.

original: bdag gis de ltar mi bya'i /
analyzed: bdag gis de ltar mi bya'i /
translated: I should not do that.

original: bdag gis glen pa dang / lkug pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis glen pa dang / lkug pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: I should act like a fool and a mute.

original: bdag gi bsam pa la 'khrug pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam pa la 'khrug pa med par bya'o //
translated: I should have no disturbance in my mind.

original: sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: I must fully and completely awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood for the sake of these sentient beings.🔽

original: yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya dgos na /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya dgos na /
translated: I must fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and lead these sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa.

original: de dag nyid la bdag ngan sems su byed pa dang de dag nyid la bdag 'khrug pa ni tshul ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag nyid la bdag ngan sems su byed pa dang de dag nyid la bdag 'khrug pa ni tshul ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not right for me to have an evil mind toward them, or to be agitated toward them.

original: bdag gis de dag la gnod sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis de dag la gnod sems su mi bya'o //
translated: I must not have an evil mind toward them.

original: bdag gis @315b de dag la 'khrug par mi bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: bdag gis @315b de dag la 'khrug par mi bya'o snyam na /
translated: I must not be agitated toward them.’

original: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'byung ba yod par ngas bshad de /
analyzed: dga' bo / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'byung ba yod par ngas bshad de /
translated: “Nanda, I explain that a bodhisattva great being who thinks like that has an appearance,

original: de la ni bdud sdig to can glags lta zhing glags tshol bas kyang glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: de la ni bdud sdig to can glags lta zhing glags tshol bas kyang glags mi rnyed do //
translated: and that Māra the evil one, looking for an opportunity and seeking an opportunity, does not get an opportunity.

original: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dag dang 'grogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bo / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dag dang 'grogs par mi bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Nanda, a bodhisattva great being should not associate with persons in the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: de dag dang lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig tu gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: should not stay with them.

original: 'dug par mi bya'o //🔽gal te 'dug na'ang des su la'ang gnod sems su mi bya /
analyzed: 'dug par mi bya'o // gal te 'dug na'ang des su la'ang gnod sems su mi bya /
translated: He should not stay there.

original: 'khrug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrug par mi bya'o //
translated: If he does stay there, he should not be hostile or angry with anyone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang bdag gis 'di dag la gnod sems su bya ba dang / 'khrug par bya ba de ni bdag la mi tshul lo //
analyzed: gang bdag gis 'di dag la gnod sems su bya ba dang / 'khrug par bya ba de ni bdag la mi tshul lo //
translated: “It is not right for me to be hostile or angry with them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: Because I should fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening for them,

original: sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su dgrol bar bya ba dag go snyam du bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su dgrol bar bya ba dag go snyam du bya'o //
translated: and I should free them from all suffering.’

original: dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: Nanda said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dag dang gnas par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dag dang gnas par bgyi /
translated: how should bodhisattva great beings live with people who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽dga' bo / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / dga' bo / 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Nanda, it is like this:

original: dper na / ston pa dang ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / ston pa dang ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as a teacher lives,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang zag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dang gnas par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should be in harmony with the person who is in the Bodhisattva Vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe @316a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe @316a *//
translated: Why is that?

original: na; 'di ni bdag gi grogs te gru gcig tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: na; 'di ni bdag gi grogs te gru gcig tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: “This is my companion, my fellow traveler in the same boat.

original: 'dis ji ltar bslab par bya ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ji ltar bslab par bya ba de bzhin du bdag gis kyang bslab par bya'o //
translated: I should train just as this one trains.

original: 'dis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: This one has trained in the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the perfection of wisdom, inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality,

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of compounded things, the emptiness of uncompounded things, the emptiness of what transcends limits, the emptiness of no beginning or end, the emptiness of nonrepudiation, the emptiness of inherent existence,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of nonapprehension, the emptiness of nonthings, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: The four kinds of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of magical power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad @316b med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad @316b med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are gateways to liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: the five kinds of supernatural knowledge, all the meditative stabilities, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four kinds of intrepid confidence, the four kinds of precise knowledge,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang la bslab par bya ba de nyid la bdag gis kyang bslab par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do //🔽des gzhan yang sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /🔽'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ston pa ste /🔽gal te de 'dres par spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang bral bar gyur na de la bdag gis bslab par mi bya'i /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang la bslab par bya ba de nyid la bdag gis kyang bslab par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed do // des gzhan yang sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste / 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam ston pa ste / gal te de 'dres par spyod cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang bral bar gyur na de la bdag gis bslab par mi bya'i /
translated: I too should train in the very same thing that the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving are trained in; I too should train in the very same thing that the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the three gateways to liberation, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, great love, great compassion, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects are trained in.”🔽“Moreover, Subhūti, he should also arouse this thought:🔽‘This is the teacher of the path to full awakening.🔽If I were to practice in a mixed way, separated from the attention endowed with the knowledge of path, I would not train in that.🔽

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas na /
translated: I too should train in the very same thing that the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving should train in; that the emptiness of form, the emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of perception, the emptiness of volitional factors, and the emptiness of consciousness should train in; that the emptiness of the eyes, the emptiness of the ears, the emptiness of the nose, the emptiness of the tongue, the emptiness of the body, and the emptiness of the thinking mind should train in; that the emptiness of a form, the emptiness of a sound, the emptiness of a smell, the emptiness of a taste, the emptiness of a feeling, and the emptiness of dharmas should train in; that the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes, the emptiness of the sensory element of sights, and the emptiness of the sensory element of eye consciousness; the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears, the emptiness of the sensory element of sounds, and the emptiness of the sensory element of ear consciousness; the emptiness of the sensory element of the nose, the emptiness of the sensory element of smells, and the emptiness of the sensory element of nose consciousness; the emptiness of the sensory element of the tongue, the emptiness of the sensory element of tastes, and the emptiness of the sensory element of tongue consciousness; the emptiness of the sensory element of the body, the emptiness of the sensory element of tangibles, and the emptiness of the sensory element of body consciousness; and the emptiness of the sensory element of the thinking, the emptiness of the sensory element of dharmas, and the emptiness of the sensory element of thinking-consciousness should train in; that the emptiness of the perfection of giving, the emptiness of the perfection of morality, the emptiness of the perfection of patience, the emptiness of the perfection of perseverance, the emptiness of the perfection of concentration, and the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom should train in; that the emptiness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the emptiness of the four noble truths, the emptiness of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the emptiness of the ten powers, the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses, the emptiness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the emptiness of great love, the emptiness of great compassion, the emptiness of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the emptiness of the ten powers, the
